snippet: The Labor Department’s last pre-election figures showed 171,000 jobs added in October. Unemployment edged up to 7.9 percent.
abstract: Labor Department's last pre-election report says 171,000 jobs were added in October, more than expected, with unemployment edging up to 7.9 percent; hints that whoever wins the election will inherit an accelerating United States economy in 2013.
lead_paragraph: The Labor Department’s last pre-election figures showed 171,000 jobs added in October. Unemployment edged up to 7.9 percent.

headline.seo: Modest Jobs Growth in Final Report Before Election
headline.main: Latest Jobs Report Shows Persistent Economic Growth
headline.print_headline: U.S. Adds 171,000 Jobs, More Than Estimated
